{"curatedLearningPathStructured":{"rationale":"Aligned recommendations for the Azure AI Engineer Associate (AI-102) based on official Microsoft Learn certification/exam pages and AI-102 study guide skill areas (plan/manage Azure AI solutions; implement generative AI, agentic solutions, vision, NLP, and knowledge mining/information extraction). With 6 hours/week over 8 weeks (~48 hours), these learning paths are sized to cover core AI-102 job-task domains and provide hands-on practice on Azure AI services.","learningPaths":[{"title":"Microsoft Certified: Azure AI Engineer Associate (Certification overview)","url":"https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/azure-ai-engineer/","estimatedHours":1,"relevance":"Primary credential target page describing the role scope and the required hands-on capabilities (Azure AI services, Azure AI Search, Azure OpenAI; using REST/SDKs in Python/C#; deployment/monitoring/responsible AI). Use it to anchor your study plan and map modules to the exam skills outline."},{"title":"Exam AI-102: Designing and Implementing a Microsoft Azure AI Solution (Exam details \u002B preparation resources)","url":"https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/exams/ai-102/","estimatedHours":1,"relevance":"Directly aligns your 8-week study plan to the current AI-102 skills measured and provides official preparation resources such as learning paths, documentation pointers, and the practice assessment."},{"title":"Study guide for Exam AI-102: Designing and Implementing a Microsoft Azure AI Solution (skills measured)","url":"https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-102","estimatedHours":2,"relevance":"Defines the exam objective domains and weighting (plan/manage solution; generative AI; agentic solutions; vision; NLP; knowledge mining \u0026 information extraction). Use it as a checklist to ensure each domain is covered within your 48-hour window."}],"modules":[{"title":"Course AI-102T00-A: Develop AI solutions in Azure","url":"https://learn.microsoft.com/training/courses/ai-102t00","skillFocus":"End-to-end AI-102 coverage (generative AI apps, AI agents, computer vision, information extraction) using Azure AI Foundry and Azure AI services; useful as a capstone structure for your 8-week plan."},{"title":"Get tips and tricks for teaching AI-102 Designing and Implementing a Microsoft Azure AI Solution","url":"https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/teach-ai-102-design-implement-microsoft-azure-ai-solution/","skillFocus":"Meta-guidance and lab/resource pointers for AI-102; helps you pick the right labs and sequence even if you\u2019re self-studying."}],"targets":[{"title":"Microsoft Certified: Azure AI Engineer Associate","type":"Certification","url":"https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/azure-ai-engineer/"},{"title":"Exam AI-102: Designing and Implementing a Microsoft Azure AI Solution","type":"Exam","url":"https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/exams/ai-102/"}]},"studyPlanStructured":{"rationale":"Milestones are mapped directly to the AI-102 skills measured domains (Plan/Manage; Generative AI; Agentic; Vision; NLP incl. Speech; Knowledge mining \u0026 information extraction). With 6 hours/week for 8 weeks (~48 hours), the plan uses four ~90-minute sessions weekly (balanced workload), sequences prerequisites first (planning, SDKs, responsible AI) before hands-on builds (RAG, agents, Vision/NLP, Search/Document Intelligence), and includes spaced reinforcement: weekly mini-reviews plus two practice-assessment checkpoints (midpoint \u002B final) to identify gaps before the final consolidation week.","planTitle":"Azure AI Engineer Associate (AI-102) \u2014 8-Week / 6 Hours-Per-Week Study Plan","durationWeeks":8,"weeklyHours":6,"weeklyMilestones":[{"weekNumber":1,"objective":"Orient to AI-102, set up your environment, and cover planning/responsible AI foundations (Foundry/Azure AI resource selection, SDKs, keys/auth basics).","sessions":[{"day":"Day 1","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Read the certification \u002B exam pages to understand scope and expectations: create a checklist you\u2019ll track weekly: https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-102","Decide your primary language (Python or C#) and note the SDKs you\u2019ll use."]},{"day":"Day 2","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["From the AI-102 course shell, note the major topic areas you\u2019ll implement over the next 8 weeks: https://learn.microsoft.com/training/courses/ai-102t00","Complete the planning module (focus: Azure AI services vs Foundry, tools/SDKs, responsible AI): https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/prepare-azure-ai-development/","Do the module knowledge check and capture weak points."]},{"day":"Day 3","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Plan/Manage focus: using the study guide, write a 1-page \u2018service selection map\u2019 (which service for: generative AI, vision, language, speech, search, document extraction).","Set up a minimal dev workspace (repo, virtualenv/.NET solution, config handling for endpoints/keys).","Draft a reusable request helper (REST or SDK) pattern you\u2019ll reuse across services (auth header, retries, logging)."]},{"day":"Day 4","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Responsible AI focus (from study guide topics): list controls you must remember for the exam (content moderation/safety, filters/blocklists, prompt shields/harm detection, governance).","Create a personal \u2018Exam Notes\u2019 document with: endpoints vs keys vs Entra ID auth, monitoring/cost concepts, and container deployment as a concept item.","Weekly review: 15-minute self-quiz against your checklist; mark items as Green/Yellow/Red."]}],"checkpoint":"Deliverables: (1) AI-102 skills checklist with status, (2) environment ready (repo \u002B config pattern), (3) 1-page service selection map \u002B responsible AI notes."},{"weekNumber":2,"objective":"Implement core generative AI patterns: model deployment basics, prompt engineering habits, and introduce RAG conceptually.","sessions":[{"day":"Day 1","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Use the study guide\u2019s Generative AI section to outline what you must be able to do (deploy model, prompt flow, RAG, evaluation, monitoring).","In Foundry (or conceptually if access-limited), note steps: hub/project/resources, model selection/deployment options.","Write 10 prompt-engineering \u2018before/after\u2019 examples (system instructions, few-shot, constraints, grounding placeholders)."]},{"day":"Day 2","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Work through a RAG overview module (grounding with your data, indexing with Azure AI Search): https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/build-copilot-ai-studio/","Focus on: why grounding, how data is indexed, and where citations come from.","Summarize the RAG pipeline in a diagram (ingest \u2192 chunk \u2192 embed \u2192 index \u2192 retrieve \u2192 prompt \u2192 generate)."]},{"day":"Day 3","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Hands-on (lightweight): implement a minimal \u2018chat\u2019 caller using your chosen SDK/REST (prompt \u002B parameters like temperature/max tokens).","Experiment with parameter changes and record outcomes (determinism vs creativity).","Add basic logging/tracing placeholders (request id, latency) to align with monitoring objectives."]},{"day":"Day 4","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["RAG reinforcement: define chunking strategy and retrieval settings you\u2019d tune (topK, filters, semantic vs vector, citations).","Create 15 flashcards: model types, embeddings usage, vector store concept, and responsible prompting safeguards.","Weekly review: update checklist; identify 3 items to revisit next week."]}],"checkpoint":"Deliverables: (1) RAG pipeline diagram, (2) minimal prompt caller code skeleton, (3) prompt/parameter experiment notes \u002B flashcards."},{"weekNumber":3,"objective":"Build RAG with Azure AI Search concepts and connect it to generative workflows (indexes, queries, vector/semantic basics).","sessions":[{"day":"Day 1","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Study the AI-102 knowledge mining objectives: provisioning Search, index/data source/indexer, querying, semantic \u002B vector store solutions.","Read the Azure AI Search training landing page to choose a path for deeper study (note the \u2018Implement knowledge mining\u2019 path reference): https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/search/resource-training","Write down: index schema essentials (fields, key, searchable/filterable/facetable/sortable)."]},{"day":"Day 2","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["RAG integration recap: revisit the RAG module sections on making data searchable and implementing RAG in a flow: https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/build-copilot-ai-studio/","Define your \u2018toy dataset\u2019 (5\u201310 docs) and how you would ingest it (blob/files).","Create a step checklist for: create index \u2192 load docs \u2192 (optional) embeddings \u2192 query \u2192 pass results into prompt context."]},{"day":"Day 3","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Search querying practice (conceptual or actual): draft example queries demonstrating filtering, sorting, wildcards, semantic vs vector intent.","Note the key verification behavior for grounded answers and citations (what \u2018good\u2019 grounding looks like).","If exploring agents later, note tool constraints for AI Search with agents (single index, tenant constraints): https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/ai-foundry/agents/how-to/tools/ai-search?view=foundry#limitations"]},{"day":"Day 4","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Weekly synthesis: write a 1-page \u2018Azure AI Search for RAG\u2019 summary: components \u002B common pitfalls.","Create 10 practice Q\u0026A items for yourself (e.g., when to use indexers vs push API, how skillsets enrich content).","Checklist update \u002B plan next week\u2019s agent focus."]}],"checkpoint":"Deliverables: (1) 1-page Search-for-RAG summary, (2) example query set, (3) step-by-step build checklist for a basic RAG solution."},{"weekNumber":4,"objective":"Implement an agentic solution: understand agents, build a basic agent, and know testing/optimization/deployment considerations.","sessions":[{"day":"Day 1","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Study the AI-102 agentic objectives (role/use cases, resources, create agent, complex workflows, test/optimize/deploy).","Complete the agent module overview units: https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/develop-ai-agent-azure/","Write down when you\u2019d choose an agent vs a single prompt/chain."]},{"day":"Day 2","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Do the agent module exercise (or simulate it with notes if you lack access) and capture: tool use, instructions, and response validation steps: https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/develop-ai-agent-azure/","Document an \u2018agent contract\u2019: inputs, tools available, tool-output formatting, and safety constraints.","Add evaluation criteria (task success, hallucination rate, grounded citations, latency)."]},{"day":"Day 3","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Connect agent \u002B retrieval conceptually: outline how the agent calls AI Search (what it sends, what it receives, how it cites).","Write 3 multi-step workflows (e.g., summarize doc set \u2192 extract action items \u2192 generate email) and specify tool calls.","Add a small \u2018testing matrix\u2019 (happy path, missing data, ambiguous question, unsafe prompt)."]},{"day":"Day 4","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Midpoint practice assessment (timed, but stop to learn): take the official practice assessment and record weak areas: https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/exams/ai-102/practice/assessment?assessment-type=practice\u0026assessmentId=61","Review results and tag your checklist items Red/Yellow.","Create a remediation list for Weeks 5\u20137 (top 5 gaps)."]}],"checkpoint":"Deliverables: (1) basic agent notes/exercise completion, (2) 3 workflow designs \u002B testing matrix, (3) practice assessment gap list with remediation targets."},{"weekNumber":5,"objective":"Implement computer vision solutions (image analysis, OCR, custom vision concepts, video insights).","sessions":[{"day":"Day 1","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Study the Vision objectives from the AI-102 study guide: visual features, object detection/tags, responses, OCR/handwriting, video indexer, spatial analysis.","Create a \u2018request/response\u2019 template: what you send (features/options) and how to interpret results.","Do a mini-drill: pick 5 sample images and predict what features you\u2019d request for each scenario."]},{"day":"Day 2","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["OCR focus: outline steps for extracting printed vs handwritten text; record common output fields and error handling.","Custom vision focus: decide classification vs object detection for 3 scenarios; write what labeling looks like and which metrics matter.","Add flashcards: metrics (precision/recall), publish/consume, and code-first model usage."]},{"day":"Day 3","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Video analysis: summarize what Azure AI Video Indexer provides (insights extraction from video/live stream).","Spatial analysis concept: presence/movement detection and typical privacy considerations.","Write 5 exam-style scenarios mapping requirement \u2192 service/feature choice."]},{"day":"Day 4","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Weekly review: consolidate vision notes into a 2-page \u2018Vision cheat sheet\u2019 (features, OCR, custom model lifecycle, video).","Revisit any Red/Yellow items from the practice assessment that relate to vision.","Checklist update."]}],"checkpoint":"Deliverables: (1) Vision cheat sheet, (2) 5 scenario-to-service mappings, (3) flashcards for custom vision lifecycle \u002B OCR."},{"weekNumber":6,"objective":"Implement NLP solutions: text analytics \u002B translation; plus speech fundamentals and customization SSML, custom speech, intent/keyword recognition.","Create a \u2018text analytics decision tree\u2019 mapping a requirement to the analysis operation.","Draft 10 short text samples and decide which NLP operation you\u2019d run and why."]},{"day":"Day 2","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Translation focus: outline translating text vs documents; note when you\u2019d translate before downstream steps (e.g., PII then translate vs translate then PII).","PII handling: write a secure-handling checklist (masking, storage, logging rules).","Create 5 exam-style scenario prompts mapping requirement \u2192 service/feature."]},{"day":"Day 3","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Speech focus: write a pipeline for speech-to-text and text-to-speech; include SSML enhancements (prosody, pronunciation).","Custom speech concept: when to customize and what evaluate/deploy looks like.","Add responsible AI/privacy notes for speech (consent, retention)."]},{"day":"Day 4","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Weekly synthesis: 1\u20132 page \u2018NLP \u002B Speech cheat sheet\u2019 with operations, inputs/outputs, and gotchas.","Quick self-test: answer 15 of your own flashcards without notes; fix weak areas.","Checklist update."]}],"checkpoint":"Deliverables: (1) NLP\u002BSpeech cheat sheet, (2) decision tree for text analytics, (3) 10 samples mapped to operations \u002B 5 scenarios."},{"weekNumber":7,"objective":"Knowledge mining \u0026 information extraction: Azure AI Search deeper concepts, Document Intelligence, and Content Understanding pipelines; tie back into RAG/agents.","sessions":[{"day":"Day 1","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Study knowledge mining objectives: skillsets/custom skills, indexers, Knowledge Store projections, semantic \u002B vector store solutions (revisit your Week 3 notes).","Refresh Azure AI Search basics from the training page references: https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/search/resource-training","Write a mini-architecture: documents (PDF/images) \u2192 OCR/enrichment \u2192 index \u2192 semantic/vector query."]},{"day":"Day 2","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Document Intelligence objectives: prebuilt models vs custom models, train/test/publish, composed models.","Create a comparison table: prebuilt vs custom vs composed (when to use, effort, data requirements).","Draft a \u2018form processing\u2019 workflow including validation and confidence thresholds."]},{"day":"Day 3","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Content Understanding objectives: OCR pipeline, summarize/classify/detect attributes, extract entities/tables/images, process/ingest multi-modal content.","Write how this differs from simple OCR \u002B LLM prompting (where structured extraction fits).","Add 5 scenarios: invoice extraction, contract clause extraction, table extraction, classification, multi-modal ingestion."]},{"day":"Day 4","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Integration day: design one end-to-end solution combining Document PII).","Checklist update \u002B prepare final practice week."]}],"checkpoint":"Deliverables: (1) comparison table for Document Intelligence approaches, (2) end-to-end architecture diagram tying extraction\u2192search\u2192RAG/agent, (3) 5 scenarios with chosen services and rationale."},{"weekNumber":8,"objective":"Final consolidation: full-domain review, targeted remediation, and final day before exam\u2019 sheet (service selection \u002B key constraints \u002B monitoring/responsible AI)."]},{"day":"Day 2","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Take the AI-102 practice assessment again \u002B exam mechanics: read the \u2018prepare for an exam\u2019 practice assessment guidance (focus on how to use results effectively): With 6 hours/week over 8 weeks (~48 hours), these learning paths are sized to cover core AI-102 job-task domains and provide hands-on practice on Azure AI services.\r\n### Learning Path Recommendations:\r\n\r\n- [Microsoft Certified: Azure AI Engineer Associate (Certification overview)](https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/azure-ai-engineer/) - Estimated hours: 1. Relevance: Primary credential target page describing the role scope and the required hands-on capabilities (Azure AI services, Azure AI Search, Azure OpenAI; using REST/SDKs in Python/C#; deployment/monitoring/responsible AI). Use it to anchor your study plan and map modules to the exam skills outline.\r\n- [Exam AI-102: Designing and Implementing a Microsoft Azure AI Solution (Exam details \u002B preparation resources)](https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/exams/ai-102/) - Estimated hours: 1. Relevance: Directly aligns your 8-week study plan to the current AI-102 skills measured and provides official preparation resources such as learning paths, documentation pointers, and the practice assessment.\r\n- [Study guide for Exam AI-102: Designing and Implementing a Microsoft Azure AI Solution (skills measured)](https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-102) - Estimated hours: 2. Relevance: Defines the exam objective domains and weighting (plan/manage solution; generative AI; agentic solutions; vision; NLP; knowledge mining \u0026 information extraction). Use it as a checklist to ensure each domain is covered within your 48-hour window.\r\n\r\n### Module Recommendations:\r\n\r\n- [Course AI-102T00-A: Develop AI solutions in Azure](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/courses/ai-102t00) - Skill focus: End-to-end AI-102 coverage (generative AI apps, AI agents, computer vision, information extraction) using Azure AI Foundry and Azure AI services; useful as a capstone structure for your 8-week plan.\r\n- [Get tips and tricks for teaching AI-102 Designing and Implementing a Microsoft Azure AI Solution](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/teach-ai-102-design-implement-microsoft-azure-ai-solution/) - Skill focus: Meta-guidance and lab/resource pointers for AI-102; helps you pick the right labs and sequence even if you\u2019re self-studying.\r\n\r\n### Certification/Exam Targets:\r\n\r\n- [Microsoft Certified: Azure AI Engineer Associate](https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/azure-ai-engineer/) - Type: Certification\r\n- [Exam AI-102: Designing and Implementing a Microsoft Azure AI Solution](https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/exams/ai-102/) - Type: Exam\r\n\r\n\r\n### Study Plan\r\n**Plan Title:** Azure AI Engineer Associate (AI-102) \u2014 8-Week / 6 Hours-Per-Week Study Plan\r\n**Rationale:** Milestones are mapped directly to the AI-102 skills measured domains (Plan/Manage; Generative AI; Agentic; Vision; NLP incl. Speech; Knowledge mining \u0026 information extraction). With 6 hours/week for 8 weeks (~48 hours), the plan uses four ~90-minute sessions weekly (balanced workload), sequences prerequisites first (planning, SDKs, responsible AI) before hands-on builds (RAG, agents, Vision/NLP, Search/Document Intelligence), and includes spaced reinforcement: weekly mini-reviews plus two practice-assessment checkpoints (midpoint \u002B final) to identify gaps before the final consolidation week.\r\n**Duration:** 8 weeks\r\n**Weekly Study Hours:** 6\r\n### Weekly Milestones:\r\n\r\n#### Week 1: Orient to AI-102, set up your environment, and cover planning/responsible AI foundations (Foundry/Azure AI resource selection, SDKs, keys/auth basics).\r\n**Checkpoint:** Deliverables: (1) AI-102 skills checklist with status, (2) environment ready (repo \u002B config pattern), (3) 1-page service selection map \u002B responsible AI notes.\r\n**Daily Sessions:**\r\n- **Day 1**: 90 minutes. Tasks: Read the certification \u002B exam pages to understand scope and expectations: https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/azure-ai-engineer/ and https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/exams/ai-102/, Skim the AI-102 study guide skills measured and create a checklist you\u2019ll track weekly: https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-102, Decide your primary language (Python or C#) and note the SDKs you\u2019ll use.\r\n- **Day 2**: 90 minutes. Tasks: From the AI-102 course shell, note the major topic areas you\u2019ll implement over the next 8 weeks: https://learn.microsoft.com/training/courses/ai-102t00, Complete the planning module (focus: Azure AI services vs Foundry, tools/SDKs, responsible AI): https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/prepare-azure-ai-development/, Do the module knowledge check and capture weak points.\r\n- **Day 3**: 90 minutes. Tasks: Plan/Manage focus: using the study guide, write a 1-page \u2018service selection map\u2019 (which service for: generative AI, vision, language, speech, search, document extraction)., Set up a minimal dev workspace (repo, virtualenv/.NET solution, config handling for endpoints/keys)., Draft a reusable request helper (REST or SDK) pattern you\u2019ll reuse across services (auth header, retries, logging).\r\n- **Day 4**: 90 minutes. Tasks: Responsible AI focus (from study guide topics): list controls you must remember for the exam (content moderation/safety, filters/blocklists, prompt shields/harm detection, governance)., Create a personal \u2018Exam Notes\u2019 document with: endpoints vs keys vs Entra ID auth, monitoring/cost concepts, and container deployment as a concept item., Weekly review: 15-minute self-quiz against your checklist; mark items as Green/Yellow/Red.\r\n\r\n#### Week 2: Implement core generative AI patterns: model deployment basics, prompt engineering habits, and introduce RAG conceptually.\r\n**Checkpoint:** Deliverables: (1) RAG pipeline diagram, (2) minimal prompt caller code skeleton, (3) prompt/parameter experiment notes \u002B flashcards.\r\n**Daily Sessions:**\r\n- **Day 1**: 90 minutes. Tasks: Use the study guide\u2019s Generative AI section to outline what you must be able to do (deploy model, prompt flow, RAG, evaluation, monitoring)., In Foundry (or conceptually if access-limited), note steps: hub/project/resources, model selection/deployment options., Write 10 prompt-engineering \u2018before/after\u2019 examples (system instructions, few-shot, constraints, grounding placeholders).\r\n- **Day 2**: 90 minutes. Tasks: Work through a RAG overview module (grounding with your data, indexing with Azure AI Search): https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/build-copilot-ai-studio/, Focus on: why grounding, how data is indexed, and where citations come from., Summarize the RAG pipeline in a diagram (ingest \u2192 chunk \u2192 embed \u2192 index \u2192 retrieve \u2192 prompt \u2192 generate).\r\n- **Day 3**: 90 minutes. Tasks: Hands-on (lightweight): implement a minimal \u2018chat\u2019 caller using your chosen SDK/REST (prompt \u002B parameters like temperature/max tokens)., Experiment with parameter changes and record outcomes (determinism vs creativity)., Add basic logging/tracing placeholders (request id, latency) to align with monitoring objectives.\r\n- **Day 4**: 90 minutes. Tasks: RAG reinforcement: define chunking strategy and retrieval settings you\u2019d tune (topK, filters, semantic vs vector, citations)., Create 15 flashcards: model types, embeddings usage, vector store concept, and responsible prompting safeguards., Weekly review: update checklist; identify 3 items to revisit next week.\r\n\r\n#### Week 3: Build RAG with Azure AI Search concepts and connect it to generative workflows (indexes, queries, vector/semantic basics).\r\n**Checkpoint:** Deliverables: (1) 1-page Search-for-RAG summary, (2) example query set, (3) step-by-step build checklist for a basic RAG solution.\r\n**Daily Sessions:**\r\n- **Day 1**: 90 minutes. Tasks: Study the AI-102 knowledge mining objectives: provisioning Search, index/data source/indexer, querying, semantic \u002B vector store solutions., Read the Azure AI Search training landing page to choose a path for deeper study (note the \u2018Implement knowledge mining\u2019 path reference): https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/search/resource-training, Write down: index schema essentials (fields, key, searchable/filterable/facetable/sortable).\r\n- **Day 2**: 90 minutes. Tasks: RAG integration recap: revisit the RAG module sections on making data searchable and implementing RAG in a flow: https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/build-copilot-ai-studio/, Define your \u2018toy dataset\u2019 (5\u201310 docs) and how you would ingest it (blob/files)., Create a step checklist for: create index \u2192 load docs \u2192 (optional) embeddings \u2192 query \u2192 pass results into prompt context.\r\n- **Day 3**: 90 minutes. Tasks: Search querying practice (conceptual or actual): draft example queries demonstrating filtering, sorting, wildcards, semantic vs vector intent., Note the key verification behavior for grounded answers and citations (what \u2018good\u2019 grounding looks like)., If exploring agents later, note tool constraints for AI Search with agents (single index, tenant constraints): https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/ai-foundry/agents/how-to/tools/ai-search?view=foundry#limitations\r\n- **Day 4**: 90 minutes. Tasks: Weekly synthesis: write a 1-page \u2018Azure AI Search for RAG\u2019 summary: components \u002B common pitfalls., Create 10 practice Q\u0026A items for yourself (e.g., when to use indexers vs push API, how skillsets enrich content)., Checklist update \u002B plan next week\u2019s agent focus.\r\n\r\n#### Week 4: Implement an agentic solution: understand agents, build a basic agent, and know testing/optimization/deployment considerations.\r\n**Checkpoint:** Deliverables: (1) basic agent notes/exercise completion, (2) 3 workflow designs \u002B testing matrix, (3) practice assessment gap list with remediation targets.\r\n**Daily Sessions:**\r\n- **Day 1**: 90 minutes. Tasks: Study the AI-102 agentic objectives (role/use cases, resources, create agent, complex workflows, test/optimize/deploy)., Complete the agent module overview units: https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/develop-ai-agent-azure/, Write down when you\u2019d choose an agent vs a single prompt/chain.\r\n- **Day 2**: 90 minutes. Tasks: Do the agent module exercise (or simulate it with notes if you lack access) and capture: tool use, instructions, and response validation steps: https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/develop-ai-agent-azure/, Document an \u2018agent contract\u2019: inputs, tools available, tool-output formatting, and safety constraints., Add evaluation criteria (task success, hallucination rate, grounded citations, latency).\r\n- **Day 3**: 90 minutes. Tasks: Connect agent \u002B retrieval conceptually: outline how the agent calls AI Search (what it sends, what it receives, how it cites)., Write 3 multi-step workflows (e.g., summarize doc set \u2192 extract action items \u2192 generate email) and specify tool calls., Add a small \u2018testing matrix\u2019 (happy path, missing data, ambiguous question, unsafe prompt).\r\n- **Day 4**: 90 minutes. Tasks: Midpoint practice assessment (timed, but stop to learn): take the official practice assessment and record weak areas: https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/exams/ai-102/practice/assessment?assessment-type=practice\u0026assessmentId=61, Review results and tag your checklist items Red/Yellow., Create a remediation list for Weeks 5\u20137 (top 5 gaps).\r\n\r\n#### Week 5: Implement computer vision solutions (image analysis, OCR, custom vision concepts, video insights).\r\n**Checkpoint:** Deliverables: (1) Vision cheat sheet, (2) 5 scenario-to-service mappings, (3) flashcards for custom vision lifecycle \u002B OCR.\r\n**Daily Sessions:**\r\n- **Day 1**: 90 minutes. Tasks: Study the Vision objectives from the AI-102 study guide: visual features, object detection/tags, responses, OCR/handwriting, video indexer, spatial analysis., Create a \u2018request/response\u2019 template: what you send (features/options) and how to interpret results., Do a mini-drill: pick 5 sample images and predict what features you\u2019d request for each scenario.\r\n- **Day 2**: 90 minutes. Tasks: OCR focus: outline steps for extracting printed vs handwritten text; record common output fields and error handling., Custom vision focus: decide classification vs object detection for 3 scenarios; write what labeling looks like and which metrics matter., Add flashcards: metrics (precision/recall), publish/consume, and code-first model usage.\r\n- **Day 3**: 90 minutes. Tasks: Video analysis: summarize what Azure AI Video Indexer provides (insights extraction from video/live stream)., Spatial analysis concept: presence/movement detection and typical privacy considerations., Write 5 exam-style scenarios mapping requirement \u2192 service/feature choice.\r\n- **Day 4**: 90 minutes. Tasks: Weekly review: consolidate vision notes into a 2-page \u2018Vision cheat sheet\u2019 (features, OCR, custom model lifecycle, video)., Revisit any Red/Yellow items from the practice assessment that relate to vision., Checklist update.\r\n\r\n#### Week 6: Implement NLP solutions: text analytics \u002B translation; plus speech fundamentals and customization concepts.\r\n**Checkpoint:** Deliverables: (1) NLP\u002BSpeech cheat sheet, (2) decision tree for text analytics, (3) 10 samples mapped to operations \u002B 5 scenarios.\r\n**Daily Sessions:**\r\n- **Day 1**: 90 minutes. Tasks: Study NLP objectives: key phrases/entities, sentiment, language detection, PII, translation; plus speech-to-text, text-to-speech, SSML, custom speech, intent/keyword recognition., Create a \u2018text analytics decision tree\u2019 mapping a requirement to the analysis operation., Draft 10 short text samples and decide which NLP operation you\u2019d run and why.\r\n- **Day 2**: 90 minutes. Tasks: Translation focus: outline translating text vs documents; note when you\u2019d translate before downstream steps (e.g., PII then translate vs translate then PII)., PII handling: write a secure-handling checklist (masking, storage, logging rules)., Create 5 exam-style scenario prompts mapping requirement \u2192 service/feature.\r\n- **Day 3**: 90 minutes. Tasks: Speech focus: write a pipeline for speech-to-text and text-to-speech; include SSML enhancements (prosody, pronunciation)., Custom speech concept: when to customize and what evaluate/deploy looks like., Add responsible AI/privacy notes for speech (consent, retention).\r\n- **Day 4**: 90 minutes. Tasks: Weekly synthesis: 1\u20132 page \u2018NLP \u002B Speech cheat sheet\u2019 with operations, inputs/outputs, and gotchas., Quick self-test: answer 15 of your own flashcards without notes; fix weak areas., Checklist update.\r\n\r\n#### Week 7: Knowledge mining \u0026 information extraction: Azure AI Search deeper concepts, Document Intelligence, and Content Understanding pipelines; tie back into RAG/agents.\r\n**Checkpoint:** Deliverables: (1) comparison table for Document Intelligence approaches, (2) end-to-end architecture diagram tying extraction\u2192search\u2192RAG/agent, (3) 5 scenarios with chosen services and rationale.\r\n**Daily Sessions:**\r\n- **Day 1**: 90 minutes. Tasks: Study knowledge mining objectives: skillsets/custom skills, indexers, Knowledge Store projections, semantic \u002B vector store solutions (revisit your Week 3 notes)., Refresh Azure AI Search basics from the training page references: https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/search/resource-training, Write a mini-architecture: documents (PDF/images) \u2192 OCR/enrichment \u2192 index \u2192 semantic/vector query.\r\n- **Day 2**: 90 minutes. Tasks: Document Intelligence objectives: prebuilt models vs custom models, train/test/publish, composed models., Create a comparison table: prebuilt vs custom vs composed (when to use, effort, data requirements)., Draft a \u2018form processing\u2019 workflow including validation and confidence thresholds.\r\n- **Day 3**: 90 minutes. Tasks: Content Understanding objectives: OCR pipeline, summarize/classify/detect attributes, extract entities/tables/images, process/ingest multi-modal content., Write how this differs from simple OCR \u002B LLM prompting (where structured extraction fits)., Add 5 scenarios: invoice extraction, contract clause extraction, table extraction, classification, multi-modal ingestion.\r\n- **Day 4**: 90 minutes. Tasks: Integration day: design one end-to-end solution combining Document Intelligence/Content Understanding \u002B Search \u002B GenAI (RAG) \u002B (optional) agent., Write what you would monitor (latency, cost, errors) and what security controls apply (keys/auth, PII)., Checklist update \u002B prepare final practice week.\r\n\r\n#### Week 8: Final consolidation: full-domain review, targeted remediation, and final practice assessment readiness.\r\n**Checkpoint:** Deliverables: (1) updated final checklist all Green/mostly Green, (2) final practice assessment results \u002B remediation notes, (3) 1-page last-day sheet \u002B 12 scenario drill answers.\r\n**Daily Sessions:**\r\n- **Day 1**: 90 minutes. Tasks: Do a full checklist pass: any Red items become today\u2019s focus; rewrite the concept in your own words., Re-skim the AI-102 skills measured headings to ensure nothing is missing: https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-102, Create a one-page \u2018last day before exam\u2019 sheet (service selection \u002B key constraints \u002B monitoring/responsible AI).\r\n- **Day 2**: 90 minutes. Tasks: Take the AI-102 practice assessment again (timed). Record score and weak objectives: https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/exams/ai-102/practice/assessment?assessment-type=practice\u0026assessmentId=61, For each missed question area, link it back to a specific study guide bullet and add a corrective note., Identify the top 3 remaining weak domains.\r\n- **Day 3**: 90 minutes. Tasks: Targeted remediation on top 3 weak domains (use your notes \u002B course outline page as a guide): https://learn.microsoft.com/training/courses/ai-102t00, Do a scenario drill: write 12 mini case-studies (2 per domain) and answer: service choice, steps, security, monitoring, responsible AI., Review your scenario answers and correct them against the skills outline.\r\n- **Day 4**: 90 minutes. Tasks: Light review \u002B exam mechanics: read the \u2018prepare for an exam\u2019 practice assessment guidance (focus on how to use results effectively): https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/prepare-exam#take-a-practice-assessment, Finalize flashcards (aim for ~40\u201360 total) and do a final pass., Stop-study plan: decide what you\u2019ll review the day before the exam (only the 1-page sheet \u002B flashcards).\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n### Engagement Plan\r\n**Rationale:** This engagement plan follows the student\u2019s 8-week AI-102 schedule with four 90-minute sessions per week, reinforcing the official Microsoft Learn resources already embedded in the plan (exam page, study guide, course, modules, Azure AI Search training, agents tool limitations, practice assessments, and exam prep guidance). Reminders are timed at consistent evening study slots to build habit, include direct links to the exact referenced material for each session, and add extra mid-week motivation notes to sustain momentum and close gaps revealed by the Week 4 and Week 8 practice assessments.\r\n**Recipient Email:** student@example.com\r\n\r\n### Reminders:\r\n- **Schedule:** 2/24/2026 6:30:00 PM, **Subject:** Week 1 Day 1 (90 min): Lock in AI-102 scope \u002B checklist, **Body:** Start by reading the AI-102 certification \u002B exam pages, then skim the official study guide and turn the Skills Measured into a checklist you\u2019ll track weekly.
